alert.note: Alert for Dorchester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 4:10AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL DORCHESTER COUNTY THROUGH 445 AM EDT... At 409 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over the Chesapeake Bay near Deal Island, or 18 miles east of Saint Inigoes Creek, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Dorchester County, including the following locations... Crocheron and Wingate. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
